answerText: The Bone People[10] Another New Zealand author, Alan Duff, wrote about these people in Once Were Warriors. The Bone People takes its title from the imagery used by these native people of New Zealand.
heading: Penn-ance |2012 | 8 | 10 | Literature | World | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: One artist in this novel won the lottery and proceeded to live in "The Tower" as a recluse. For 10 points each: [10] Name this work about the mute boy Simon who washed up on a beach, was adopted by Joe and Hana Gillayley, and befriends Kerewin.
